title: Central European Research in TRAnsport INfrastructure

author: Aleš Žnidarič, Slovenian National Building and Civil Engineering Institute

segmentation: Thank you very much.
First of all, if you see me running around this building these days, this is because I'm having some problems with organization so.
This this is the reason.
Otherwise I'm also the reason why we're here because I'm coordinating this certain coordination action.
Certain stands for Central European Research in transport infrastructure, and as you will see a bit later.
One of the tasks that we set up.
For ourselves was to present properly these activities during the puree.
And This is why we are here today.
So what is certain certain is, first of all, cluster of three projects which are focusing on new Member States and other non so other countries that are not yet members of the European Union.

And we have responded to the call from the Six Framework Program which said that we should provide a project on design and manufacture of new construction concepts for roads and how to improve these things.
I will not go into details about it.
So what were the reasons that we applied for it?
First of all.
When we discussed, let's say, sometimes in 2000 and two 2003, why there is such a poor success of the new Member State countries in European Commission finance projects?
We found the first obstacle, and this is the percentage of people who speak English, which is, as you know.
Let's say the official language.
In that listing, research community in European Union.
And as you can see, some of those bars are pretty low, so this was clearly one of the reasons why some participants did not want even to take efforts to to get involved.

Then the second reason was that if we go back to the 4th Framework and 5th framework programs, there were only a few new Member State countries, not even new Member State countries at that time, but only a few of them were active in this framework projects.
These countries was like Poland, Czech Republic, Hungary, Slovenia and then it went down quite rapidly.
So obviously there was something to be done in this area.
And what really initiated his activities was very poor success in the first 2 calls of the Six Framework Program in the area of Rd Transport.
When the statistics was done, it turned out that only 6% of partners was from the new Member States and only three.
Center funding went to the new Member States.
If we compare this to about 25% of population of the Member States in the European Union, you can see clearly see the problem.
So then the activity started first.
This was still the second call we proposed project called Better Roads across Central Europe, which failed, which was another sign of alarm.
So then we call the meeting in Lugana with the directors of.
Researching to choose from the new Member States, Louisa Priester was there and she came with some very ambitious proposals.
What we should do for the third call, which was in April 2005.
So we proposed.
Four projects.
Three of them were successful and you see the presentative solve these three projects here.
And we started to do some work.
So I will not go into details.
To hear more about them, I will just concentrate now on certain.
The coordination action that.
I'm representing but before doing so I have put on the map of Europe with all the countries that are involved into this cluster of three projects so you can see that there are.
I think there are 16 or even 18 countries.
Approximately evenly split between the new Member States and the.
Old European Union countries.
We have three coordinators from the two countries.
Of the new Member States and we are approximately half way of the work that should be done.
If and I concentrate on certain certain resignation is a coordination action, so it doesn't.
It doesn't only coordinate research activities, but it does not finance research.
So this is the main difference compared to the the next two presentations that you will.
Sure.
And it has a few objectives.
The first one is to establish and maintain efficient links between the project in this area.
So we are trying to do as much as possible together with Spence and certain, and also with the other projects in this area that are related to this topic.
The second one is the registered end users from the new Member States and candidate countries into a joint database that we know.
Whom should we deal with?
Whom should we call if we have something to report, something to advertise?
The second one is linked to the previous one, so to develop a web based platform to provide links with these end users so that they can also connect to each other without our interference.
The first one is to organize workshops.

In modern languages you remember the graph about the knowledge of English, so we said it would be a good idea that we we organized local workshops in local languages where we will present not only results of the projects that are in the cluster, but also everything which has already been finished.
For example, and is related to the subject because we know from experience that.
Whites or too many reports.
Too many good reports provided by other projects are stolen in drawers and never reach the end users.
So the idea here is to gather together a large group of, let's say, local people.
And present this material in local languages.
And the last one is to translate some of the key documents of this cluster project.
So we will do some translation of spains and artist projects and it will be available.
I think we promised in five different languages.
I would just focus on two things.
One is organizational workshops.
This is also very important, so you can see on the top.
For workshops, seminars which are organized, let's say on the international level, so one of them is session at the Theater, 1008 Indiana.
So this is what you are.
Sitting in at this moment.
We already had one session, one seminar in Brussels last year and we will continue until the end of the session until the end of the project, which is in 2010 and down there.
You can see these five national workshops that are planned.
And the second.

Important thing was to organize project management trainings for coordinators of this kind of research projects, because clearly there were no good candidates or volunteers to do to do this kind of work.
That's why we organized two training sessions in Brussels.
Both were done last year.
So we organized two courses, each was in two phases, so the first one was more theoretical than all participants got homework.
They had to do over about two or three months, and they came back to the follow up session where they discussed the results and their experiences.

I think altogether we had around 60 participants in both courses, which is quite a good number I think, and our objective was to have at least 50% of those people for the new Member States and I'm glad to say that we achieve these goals.
So I think there was more than 50% from the new Member States.
These were the main goals to develop understanding on the specific requirements related to European Commission projects.
So first some really basics on project management and then what you have to put attention to.
While you are preparing proposals, for example.
The second important one was to increase familiarity with the European Commission structure and also to meet some people from European Commission.
But you know that you can call them that they are there to help you, and they are not something that you should be afraid of.
And there is quite a large.
The task on exploitation.
So how to distribute all results of this project in the most efficient way?
So the current status we.
We're halfway through at the moment.
We have half of international events completed this year.
Actually thinking a month we are start starting with the national workshops.
We decided not to be too quick because we want to show some results from Spence and artists, and they're just halfway through, so they will have something to show.
We have both project management training courses finished, so this was done and the translation is of course still ahead of us because we're still expecting the main results of other projects.
With this I conclude this short presentation and I will be very glad if you will have any questions afterwards.
Thank you.
